Recode and order education levels from OpenSRP data

recode_opensrp_education.Rd

This function recodes raw education responses from OpenSRP datasets into standardized, English-labeled education levels. It also converts the result into an ordered factor reflecting increasing levels of formal education.

Usage

recode_opensrp_education(df)

Arguments

df

A data frame that includes a column named education, containing raw education labels such as "Epp", "Ceg", "Lycee", "University", or "None".

Value

A data frame with two additional columns:

education_level

A character vector with recoded education categories.

education_level_clean

An ordered factor with levels: "no_formal_education" < "primary" < "lower_secondary" < "upper_secondary" < "higher_education".

Details

The recoding is based on the following mapping:

"Epp""primary"
"Ceg""lower_secondary"
"Lycee""upper_secondary"
"University""higher_education"
"None""no_formal_education"
